snippet: Investors are eagerly awaiting an initial public offering of stock from Facebook, but otherwise they are still recovering from a tepid market in 2011.
abstract: Investors are eagerly awaiting an initial public offering of stock from Facebook, but otherwise they are still recovering from a tepid market in 2011.
lead_paragraph: More than 200 American companies are waiting to go public, the largest number in roughly a decade, reports Evelyn M. Rusli of The New York Times. Investors are eagerly anticipating an offering from Facebook, but other companies like Yelp may not get such a warm reception. Read the entire article in DealBook.

headline.main: Facebook Aside, Market for I.P.O.'s Stays Cool
